name: Venison Tenderloin
author: REDWINE48
summary: Marinate venison in a red wine based marinade for 12-36 hours depending on size of meat and age of deer. Then remove from marinade and grill or roast until meat is medium rare.
directions: Combine the red wine, cider vinegar, onion, garlic, bay leaves, thyme and rosemary in a medium bowl, and mix well
Transfer to a large resealable bag, and put the venison tenderloin into the bag
Close tightly, pressing out as much air as you can
Place meat in the refrigerator to marinate, turning two or three times, for at least 12 hours
Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C)
Remove meat from marinade, and place on a roasting rack in a roasting pan
Roast in the oven for 2 to 2 1/2 hours or to your desired degree of doneness
For medium rare, the internal temperature of the roast should be at least 150 degrees F (65 degrees C) when taken with a meat thermometer
Let the roast stand for 15 to 20 minutes before carving
While the tenderloin roasts, heat marinade in a saucepan over medium heat
Simmer until the liquid is reduced by 1/3
